Dasha_(singer):
{{Short description|American country singer-songwriter (born 2000)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=April 2024}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Dasha | image = | image_upright = | image_size = | birth_name = Anna Dasha Novotny | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|2000|02|27}} | birth_place = [[San Luis Obispo, California]], U.S. | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Pop music|Pop]] * [[Country music|country]]{{cite news |last1=Wong |first1=Curtis M |title=With 'Austin,' Country Artist Dasha Line-Dances Her Way To TikTok Stardom |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/dasha-austin-tiktok-country-song_n_65e78289e4b0d2a2475aeea7 |access-date=2 April 2024 |agency=HuffPost}} }} | occupation = {{flatlist| * Singer * songwriter }} | instrument = {{flatlist| * Vocals * guitar }} | years_active = 2021–present | label = {{flatlist| * [[Disruptor Records|Disruptor]] * [[Warner Records|Warner]] }} | website = }} '''Anna Dasha Novotny''' (born February 27, 2000) is an American country and pop singer-songwriter. She has released one EP, ''$hiny Things'' (2021), and two studio albums: ''Dirty Blonde'' (2023) and ''What Happens Now?'' (2024). Her song "[[Austin (Dasha song)|Austin]]" peaked at No. 18 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in 2024. ==Biography== ===Early life and education=== Dasha was born and raised in [[San Luis Obispo, California]], and is of [[Czechs|Czech]] descent. When she was 5 years old, she started participating in [[musical theater]] productions. She danced ballet and hip hop. She won national poetry competitions in school and then learned to play the guitar and piano at age 8. Her dad was her first [[talent manager]] and booked gigs for her in coffee shops and wineries at age 10. Her brother, who is a guitarist for [[Beauty School Dropout (band)|Beauty School Dropout]], helped produce her music. She released her first song when she was 13 years old after her father gave her a small recording budget.{{cite news | url=https://www.today.com/popculture/music/who-is-dasha-austin-rcna146713 |last=Wood |first=Becca |title=Dasha performs her hit 'Austin' at the CMT Music Awards — her first time visiting the Texas city | work=[[Today (American TV program)|Today]] | date=April 8, 2024}}{{Cite magazine | url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/dasha-austin-song-tiktok-dance-chartbreaker-may-2024-interview-1235675010/ | title=Chartbreaker: Dasha Left a Lover in the Dust — and Lassoed a Country-Pop Breakout With 'Austin' | first=Jessica | last=Nicholson | magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] | date=May 7, 2024}} She attended [[San Luis Obispo High School]], where she performed in ''[[Guys and Dolls]]'' (2016), ''[[Footloose (musical)|Footloose]]'' (2017), ''[[Annie (musical)|Annie]]'' (2018), and ''[[Bye Bye Birdie]]'' (2018) and was also a member of the Improv Team.{{Cite news | url=https://sites.google.com/slcusd.org/drama/players/alumni/anovotny | title=Dasha Novotny | work=[[San Luis Obispo High School]]}} She then attended [[Belmont University]] until the onset of the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], when she [[dropped out]] to pursue her music career.{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/business/record-labels/austin-dasha-signs-warner-records-1235640308/ |last=Nicholson |first=Jessica |title='Austin' Hitmaker Dasha Signs to Warner Records | magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] | date=March 25, 2024}} ===Career=== Dasha released the single "Don't Mean a Thing" through Famouz Records in April 2020. Later that year, she signed with Quadio Records, a subsidiary of [[Disruptor Records]]. "Don't Mean a Thing" and the follow up singles "None of My Business", "$hiny Things", and "21st Birthday" appeared on the 2021 [[extended play]] ''$hiny Things'' released through Quadio Records. In 2021 and 2022, Dasha released singles for her debut album ''Dirty Blonde'' (2023). In November 2023, Dasha released the single "[[Austin (Dasha song)|Austin]]", a foray into [[country music]] which marked her first entry on the ''[[Billboard charts]]'' and peaked at number 19 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in June 2024. The song was also successful worldwide, peaking within the top ten of the charts in Belgium (Flanders), Ireland, the Netherlands, Norway, and the United Kingdom.{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/billboard-charts-first-timers-dasha-yard-act-ole-60-1235632307/ |last=Zellner |first=Xander |title=10 First-Timers on Billboard's Charts This Week: Dasha, Yard Act, Ole 60, Charlotte Cardin & More | magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] | date=March 13, 2024}} That month, she signed with [[Warner Records]].{{cite news |url=https://musicrow.com/2024/03/dasha-signs-with-warner-records/ | last=Hollabaugh |first=Lorie |title=Dasha Signs With Warner Records | work=[[MusicRow]] |date=March 25, 2024}} Her second full-length album, ''What Happens Now?'' was released in February 2024. In April 2024, she performed "Austin" live at the 2024 CMT Awards in Austin, Texas. In August 2024 she performed “Austin” live at Allsång på Skansen in Sweden. In September 2024, she will make her first award show performance at the [[2024 Canadian Country Music Awards]].{{cite web|url=https://ca.billboard.com/music/awards/kd-lang-reclines-reunion|title=k.d. lang and The Reclines To Reunite After 35 Years At The 2024 CCMA Awards|first=Kerry|last=Doole|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] Canada|date=September 4, 2024|access-date=September 11, 2024}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+List of albums, with selected details ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Details ! scope="col" colspan="5"| Peak chart positions |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;"| [[Billboard 200|US]]
